goal.title: Goal

2019.intro:
Ever wondered how to balance economic, social and environmental interests?

In this game, you can explore how preferences on the three dimensions of sustainability - economy, socitey, and environment - affect what future power system design is perceived as optimal.

For a start you get assigned a Point Of View (POV) that indicates you how to weigh the three dimensions of sustainbility when making decisions on the future European power system design throughout the game.

The goal is to maximise your score in the year 2050. The score is based on the three indicators that you see on the right hand side of the window and which each relate to one of the three dimensions of sustainability. You can click on the indicators to illustrate them in the map. In the map you can select indivdual countries to explore their performance over time.

One can quickly play multiple rounds of the game. At the end of each round you can access the 'Sore'-board and see how your POV, decisions, and score compare across rounds.

The indicators and score are calculated based a large number of scenarios from the Open Source energy Model Base for Europe (OSeMBE), an open-source energy system optimisation model. You can read more about this game in the 'About' section, including the link to the documentation of OSeMBE.

2020.intro:
In order to maximize your score in 2050, you are now asked for some climate policy choices.

Remember that you need to take your assigned point of view into account when making your choices.
2020.transmissionDecision: Do you want to implement the 10-year network development plan on transboundary grid capacity?
2020.ccsDecision: Do you want to allow Carbon Capture and Storage (CCS)?
2020.emissionsDecision: Which restrictions are you willing to set in order to reduce your emissions?

2030.biomassDecision: Do you want to implement a ban on biomass imports for power generation to the EU?

2040.biomassDecision: Do you want to keep/implement a ban on biomass imports for power generation to the EU?

options.lowReduction: Low reduction rate – as currently in EU ETS
options.mediumReduction: Medium reduction rate – net-Zero power sector in 2045
options.highReduction: High reduction rate – net-Zero power sector in 2035

decisions.keepEmission: Do you want to keep your emission reduction rate for the next 10 years or change it?
decisions.keepCCS: Should Carbon Capture and Storage (CCS) be/remain allowed for the next 10 years?
decisions.yourPOW: Your assigned point of view in this game

score.intro-2: Your decisions are measured against the optimal decisions for your assigned point of view.
score.intro-3:
Your decisions are measured against the optimal decisions for your assigned point of view.
Check out how this round compares to your previous rounds in the score board by clicking above on 'Score'.
For your next round, keep in mind how your decisions in combination with your point of view worked and try to strategise to identify how decisions affect the different sustainability dimensions. After each round you can return to the 'Score' page and compare how decision and point of view combinations worked out.

startmodal.title: Your point of view
startmodal.intro: The pie chart below illustrates your point of view. The largest slice of the pie is your main priority.
startmodal.details:
You impact each of these three components with your decisions in 2020, 2030, and 2040. You are measured by the result in 2050 as follows:

- Economic: Lower investment cost per capita in 2050 are better
- Social: Cheaper access to electricity for everyone in 2050 is better
- Environmental: Lower annual CO2 emissions in 2050 are better
